page.title: 01Watchfield Village
page.content: Watchfield has an approximate population of 1500.In the centre of the village the altitude is 372 feet,falling in the south-west to 300 feet.The soil is stone,sub-soil and clay.The village is bordered by arable farmland,Beckett Estate and a Golf Course.Watchfield is situated eight miles from Swindon,24 miles from Oxford,four and a half miles from the market town of Faringdon and three and a half miles from the market town of Highworth; the village rests in the Vale of the White Horse District of Oxfordshire.The main trunk road from Oxford to Swindon used to run on the border of the village and the Beckett Estate and in October 1984 a new bypass was built to the north of the village witch will serve the interests of both Watchfield and the neibouring village
